channel.title: Global warming, the over exaggerated facts
channel.description:
Well most of you who have ventured out of their dark rooms with a blanket draped over the window this month has learned that the major problem facing the planet (global warming) may be a thing of the past soon. Turns our the earth has its own way of handling the build up of heat by releasing more heat from its atmosphere. Oh no, what will Al Gore live for now? I'm totally [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h05YfP_8UsU&feature=related]Cereal[/url] guys...
http://news.yahoo.com/nasa-data-blow-gaping-hold-global-warming-alarmism-192334971.html

item.title: Global warming, the over exaggerated facts
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

I always had a feeling none of it was real… Especially after watching “The Day After Tomorrow” and seeing how unrealistic it actually was…

Read full topic

item.title: Global warming, the over exaggerated facts
item.dc:creator: @mcbeans mcbeans
item.description:
@mcbeans wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:30, topic:406991”]Rofl, it said " …than alarmist computer models have predicted" so many times in that article!

So, if it’s letting all this heat out think about how much more radiation from the Sun is being let in than alarmist computer models have predicted. Cereal you guys. Super cereal.[/quote]
im caca for coocoo puffs

Read full topic

item.title: Global warming, the over exaggerated facts
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Lila­c:

But there’s still the threat of 70% of avaliable drinking water being gone by 2025.

How? Things don’t just disappear. Water is easily filtered and we have A LOT of it. When we send something down the drain it doesn’t go into a black whole and shoot to a different dimension. It’s still here. The only water lost, is the water we take to space and doesn’t get returned. Which isn’t a lot.

Read full topic
